predicate.note: Frames file for 'sew' based on sentences in wsj. Verbnet entries 9.7-1, 26.1, 22.3-2; Framenet entry Attaching.

role.descr: agent, entity causing two objects to be attached

example.name: all args
example.text: John sewed Mary's mouth shut with baling wire.

roleset.name: create clothes by sewing

example.name: lacking end state
example.text: John sewed a lovely formal gown out of burlap sacks.

roleset.note: Unlike 'build' (the prototype of the class), 'sew' doesn't seem to take an explicit end state, subsuming it instead into the construction itself. Interesting.

example.name: automatically generated
example.text: `` They do n't want Japan to monopolize the region and sew it up , '' says Chong-sik Lee , professor of East Asian politics at the University of Pennsylvania .

frameset.note: All that work framing for one lousy example.
